uuid: You are done debating. You are done modeling. You need a Cockpit.
A pilot does not calculate drag coefficients while flying; he looks at a dial that says "FUEL LOW."
Here is the specification for your "Unified Protocol Dashboard."
It answers your question on data sources: You cannot derive this from Cash alone. You need Net Liquidity (Total Account Value) and Option Buying Power from the broker.
THE DATA INPUTS (What to feed the beast)

title: you need 3 numbers from your broker (Thinkorswim / IBKR) every week:

uuid: * Net Liquidity: (Total Account Value: Stock + Cash + Options).
* Current Maintenance Margin: (How much BP you are currently using).
* Goal: Show exactly how much "Gas" is in the tank
title: discounting the broker's fake numbers.

uuid: * Zone 3 (Red): 50% to 100%. Label: "KILL ZONE (Broker Panic Risk)."
If your marker is in the Green
title: you can sell more spreads.

uuid: * Goal: Detect if we are bleeding to death slowly (The Advisor's warning).
VISUAL: Simple Number with Traffic Light

title: $378k).

uuid: * üî¥ RED: Drawdown > 10% (below $340k). (Status: "SLOW GRIND PROTOCOL: CUT SIZE 50%").
* Goal: Ensure you never trade naked.
* Data Source: Manual Input or Portfolio Scan.
* ‚ùå NAKED: (Red Background). Text: "HALT TRADING. BUY HEDGE."
* Goal: Show what is achievable safely (not fantasyland).
* Formula: Current Margin Used x 10% Yield.

project: DO NOT FORCE IT. Check Widget 1. If Widget 1 is full

uuid: Paste this text permanently on the right side of the dashboard. It removes the need to "think."

title: Size is cut by 50%.

uuid: >  * THE INCOME: "Fragile Income" (Spreads) buys Assets. "Real Income" (Assets) pays Life.

Fwd: VAT account
notes: ---------- Forwarded message ----------

uuid: We have become aware of a criminal scheme whereby fraudsters create a Government Gateway ID with HMRC
title: pretending to be a business owner
project: and submit false VAT returns to try and obtain large refunds. This is an attempt to claim money from HMRC
area: not to take any money from the affected business
tags: however it does cause problems for the business as they are unable to submit their own VAT returns until the problem is resolved.

uuid: This most commonly affects businesses who have been VAT registered for three years or more and may not have their own Government Gateway ID for VAT.

HMRC regularly recognises these attempts and writes to affected businesses with instructions on how to recover their accounts. If you receive a letter from HMRC entitled ‚ÄòFraudulent Access to your Business Tax Account‚Äô please do not ignore it
title: and do follow the instructions in the letter.

uuid: Our recommendation to all of our VAT registered clients is as follows:
‚Ä¢ If you have a Government Gateway (Business Tax) account
title: please log in to it and check all of your details are correct and up to date including contact numbers/addresses and bank details if applicable.

uuid: ‚Ä¢ If you do not have a Business Tax account
title: you should set one up and link your VAT to it.

uuid: To set up a Business Tax account:
Click on the following link: Sign in using Government Gateway - Government Gateway - GOV.UK
You will be prompted to enter your email address
title: name and some other basic details before HMRC will issue a Government Gateway ID which is a 12 digit number and will be sent to the email address you provided.

uuid: It is very important you keep the Government Gateway ID safe as you will need this to log in to your account in future.
To add VAT to your Business Tax account:
If you already have a Business Tax account but have not linked VAT to it you can click ‚ÄòManage account‚Äô and ‚Äòadd a tax to your account‚Äô then follow the instructions below.
If you have set up a new account
title: the first time you log in you will be prompted to add a tax to your account:

uuid: ‚Ä¢ Select ‚ÄòVAT and VAT services‚Äô and click continue
‚Ä¢ You will need the following details to add VAT; please contact us if you are unable to find any of them:

title: registration date
project: and postcode of your registered business address.

uuid: ‚Ä¢ The ending month and box 5 figure from your latest VAT return.
This will link VAT to your Business Tax account so you will be able to see your VAT returns
title: deadlines and amounts due
project: as well as adding your bank details to allow for quicker refunds if applicable. You can also then add other taxes to your account such as corporation tax and PAYE and track these too.

uuid: If it fails and you receive the message ‚ÄúThis business‚Äôs VAT has already been added to another business tax account‚Äù then please search your emails for a previously issued Government Gateway ID. If you still cannot link VAT to an account of your own please notify APS
title: so we can check if you have been affected
project: and call HMRC VAT online services helpdesk on 0300 200 3701 to recover your account.

uuid: If you have any questions please contact me.

title: protecting you from accountancy fees associated in dealing with any HMRC enquiry or dispute.
